channel.title: Mamamia Out Loud on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics
channel.description: Recent content in Mamamia Out Loud on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: Is Oprah's Weight Everybody's Business? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Oprah Winfrey has openly discussed her body for 35 years. Recently, she shared that she’s using weight loss medication, but did she owe us this “confession”? Plus, should we be ‘sporting’ our periods? There’s a group of women in sport wearing their period blood to break the stigma, but is this the best approach? And, we discuss how the conversation around Matthew Perry’s death quickly changed over the weekend.

item.title: The Australians Who You’re Still Allowed To Hit | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Apparently, one in four Australians still think smacking is “necessary” to properly raise kids. But it’s now illegal in 60 countries including New Zealand… so why are we so far behind? Plus, celebrity divorces, more royals drama and some very surprising trends - here are our predictions for 2024. And, we wrap up our bests and worsts of the week which include a milestone birthday, Jon Hamm and a Clare baby update.

item.title: One Of Us Is Triggered By The ATAR Chat | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Is a university degree worth striving for in 2023? As Year 12 students around Australia receive their ATARs this week, university applications are at their lowest level in a decade. We unpack. Plus, Holly has formed a relationship theory thanks to Ben Affleck’s two (Jennifers) wives. Do we all have a 'type,' and should we avoid them? And… is having 50+ pairs of underwear too much?

item.title: Time Magazine’s Grudge Of The Year | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Can you hold a grudge as well as Taylor Swift and Jessie Stephens? Apparently, there’s still bad blood between Kanye and Taylor, but should we just all move on? Plus, how did Abbie Chatfield manage to lose $500K last year and what does female hustle culture have to do with it? And, merry De-friend December and happy Breakup Day to those who celebrate. ’Tis the season to feel anxious, overwhelmed and end all sorts of relationships.

item.title: Strife Behind-The-Scenes (Part 3): The Scenes That Didn't Make It | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Welcome to the final instalment of our exclusive series going deep behind-the-scenes of Binge’s new show Strife! We've made it to the pointy end of the season, where things have turned to chaos in the Eve Life office. In this episode we're covering episodes seven and eight... plus a sneak peek into what's in store for season two. Once again, spoilers warning! The End Bits: Watch all 8 episodes of Strife on Binge here.

item.title: Strife Behind-The-Scenes (Part 2): Being Exposed On Live TV | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Welcome to the second instalment of our exclusive series going deep behind-the-scenes of Binge’s new show Strife! Today we’re delving into episodes four, five and six. From Mia's TV appearances that have not gone so well to interviews being twisted and taken out of context. And a reminder there will be SPOILERS. The End Bits: Watch all 8 episodes of Strife on Binge here. Listen to more Exclusive Strife Content: The Questions We Have About Strife, Answered Listen to more Exclusive Strife Content: Ending Your Marriage Over A Flat White - Behind The Scenes Of Strife Part 1 Read: Inspiration behind TV show Strife: How I built a media company from my lounge room.

item.title: Strife Behind-The-Scenes (Part 1): Ending Your Marriage Over A Flat White | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Welcome to our exclusive series going deep behind-the-scenes of Binge’s new show Strife! It’s loosely based on the creation of Mamamia and Mia's memoir Work Strife Balance, so of course we have hidden easter eggs and writers room tea to share with you. From getting the cast & crew together, to those first viral moments, and dealing with writer's block... Strap yourself in as we go deep on episodes one, two & three.

item.title: Whatever You Do, Don't Date Rob | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia ‘Chadfishing’ verb Men who use dating apps to stand up women as revenge. This episode we unpack this disturbing trend and why you should avoid ‘Rob’ and his mates at all costs. Plus, there’s a new test to run past and present relationships through, which involves… an orange peel. And wrapping up with our best and worst of the week—featuring a global premiere, ill-timed lactation and a hormonal rollercoaster Holly thought was all over.

item.title: The Questions We Have About Strife, Answered | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Is Evelyn based on Mia? Did THAT scene really happen? How does a book become a TV show? Holly asks Jessie and Mia all the questions we’re dying to know about the new series Strife. The End Bits: Watch all 8 episodes of Strife on Binge here. Listen to our latest subscriber episode: Can Marriage Be Feminist? A Friendly Argument Sign up to the Mamamia Out Loud Newsletter for all our recommendations in one place.

item.title: An Open Letter To Influencers | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description LAZY GEWL GIVEAWAYS!!! Why do people love to hate influencers? Tech founder, (and influencer) Michelle Battersby, has gone viral in their defence. Plus, are eldest daughters really the under-appreciated backbone of the family? Science says you have the right to be mad. And, there’s an ongoing debate about the Beta Male versus the Alpha Male. Why has ‘beta’ become such a loaded term for men in 2023? The End Bits: Subscribe to Mamamia Listen to our latest episode: Can Marriage Be Feminist?

item.title: A Debate About Filming Sex At Schoolies | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description onlyfans-schoolies-boys Transcript

item.title: The Two Royal Names We’ve Been Arguing About All Day | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Two senior royals have been named as alleged ‘racists’ in the Dutch copy of Omid Scobie’s new biography, Endgame: Inside the Royal Family and the Monarchy’s Fight for Survival. We unpack how it all happened (apparently by accident) and whether or not we should even reveal the royals in question. The names of 60 women were read out in parliament this week, all were killed by men in their lives this year.

item.title: 117 Reasons Not To Have Kids | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia One woman has gone viral for listing all the reasons why she doesn’t want to have kids (including vaginal changes, swelling and general noise), but looking at the list do we blame her? Plus, one brand is allegedly air-brushing stretchmarks ON to their models now. Is this progress or just cynical marketing? And, consent at hens and bucks parties… we unpack one very tricky dilemma.

item.title: The Dating Trend We Didn't Expect | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Are you hearing the term “both-sidesism”? We dive into what it is and why senior Australian media figures have called it out. Plus, Brad Pitt’s kids think he’s an “awful human being” and Holly can’t believe it. But celebrity kids airing their family drama isn’t exactly new... are we sensing a pattern? And, have we given dating apps the boot? Swiping non-stop feels like a part-time gig for Gen Z, but how are other generations feeling about looking for love online?

item.title: Matt Rife: Hot Comedian Tells Bad Joke | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia We need to talk about season 6 of The Crown. Holly’s been shouting at the TV, while Mia’s obsessing over the Princess Diana plot line, and Jessie? Well, she couldn’t care less. Plus, comedian Matt Rife has decided he doesn’t want women in his audiences anymore. So he’s told an offensive joke to repel them all. We discuss. And, we wrap up our best and worst of the which, which includes; some rules around sleep, a new hair do and a very sad story about birds.

item.title: What Kyle & Jackie O’s $200M Tells Us About Class | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia The largest Australian radio deal of all time has just been announced, locking in another 10 years for Kyle & Jackie O for a huge sum. They certainly weren’t shy about revealing their earnings this time around, but is this transparency refreshing or problematic? Plus, ethical non-monogamy is everywhere. But what is it and is it actually ‘ethical’? We discuss. And, would Clare and Jessie Stephens like us to stop referring to them as “the twins”?

item.title: What About Me. It Isn't Fair | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Harry Styles might be balding and Justin Timberlake is definitely dad-dancing. Has ageism finally come for the famous men? Part of Holly thinks it’s about damn time. Plus, the ‘What About Me’ effect. Why do we expect everything we see on the internet to be perfectly tailored to us and should we just get over ourselves? And, is scheduling a weekend brunch something to look forward to?

item.title: Okay Fine. We'll Tell You Our Ghost Stories | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia There are two types of people: A) the person who invites everyone to everything and B) the person who wants a strict guest list when hosting an event. Which one are you? Plus, did that vase just move on its own? After listening to an eerie podcast about ghosts, Holly, Jessie and Elfy share their own spooky stories. And, we wrap up our best and worst of the week which includes… the world, brilliant women and an unsponsored discussion about Jessie's favourite new place to shop.

item.title: In Defence Of Whinging Young Women | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia It’s been three weeks since Matthew Perry died, and all of the predictions he made in his memoir have reigned true. We discuss if the private lives of celebrities are no longer private after they’re gone. Plus, we delve into the fig tree analogy, which explores all the different branches of life, and ask the question: If I follow one path, am I giving up on the other?

item.title: Is Taylor Swift Crowdsourcing A Husband? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce were filmed kissing next to a portaloo at her latest Eras Tour show, and like Mia, the Swifties are obsessed with this relationship. But is their honeymoon phase way too public? Plus, do you actually feel like a grown up? Or more like an imposter who belongs at the kids table? We unpack why so many adults feel this way.

item.title: Princess Mary’s Very Bad Week | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Every public school kid in Queensland is celebrating today after finding out the state government is introducing a four-day school week. But how will it work for busy parents? We discuss. Plus, Princess Mary of Denmark (yes our Mary) is in the headlines this week, with speculation about her husband, Prince Fredrick’s alleged affair with a Mexican socialite. But, is the commentary unfair or just part of the territory of being a royal?

item.title: The Friendship Dip Is Coming For You | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Have we all just forgotten how to work? One barefooted man seems to think we have and he’s given us some tips to get back into it. But, do we agree? Plus, will the real Mia Freedman please stand up? The first trailer for Strife, a TV series loosely based on Mia’s book Work, Strife, Balance, is out now and the buzz around it has Mia squirming.

item.title: The Questions That Make You Rude | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia On the show today, we discuss the 'Good Bloke' myth after the headmaster of a prestigious Sydney school faced criticism for comments made about a former student/suspected killer. Excuse me, you can’t ask that… Or can you? We unpack Louis Theroux's theory about asking the questions 'we're not supposed to ask.' And Jessie Stephens is officially back from maternity leave, so we get an honest recap of the last four months.

item.title: Shut Up. The Weight-Loss Chat You Can’t Have | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Do we have a right to talk about weight loss injections? Or does the body positivity movement have a point? We discuss. Plus, this week Mia met Mitch Larsson, a former male escort. Holly is asking the questions you always wanted answers to about the life of a man who was paid for sex. And, we wrap up our best and worst of the week which include one particular Matilda’s love life, brilliant midlife women and a brand new body part.

item.title: What We Wish We’d Never Told You | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia What happens after you share something personal without entirely thinking it through? The “vulnerability hangover” kicks in. We unpack why Britney Spears’ new memoir has us wondering about the aftermath of self-disclosure. Plus, no phones at the dinner table! The owner of a fancy New York restaurant has banned influencers for simply doing their jobs. Is snapping a pic of your food really a punishable crime?

item.title: The One Where We Lost A Friend | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Beloved actor Matthew Perry, known for his 10-year role as Chandler Bing on Friends, unexpectedly passed away this weekend. We unpack his career, struggle with addiction and his profoundly honest memoir. And, is it cold in here? No, it’s just Kim Kardashian’s latest SKIMS product. She’s saving the planet one nipple bra at a time, but Holly, Mia and Clare aren’t all on board with the new trend.

item.title: Revisiting Our Conversation About Matthew Perry’s Memoir | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description In November 2022, Mia, Holly and Jessie recorded a special subscriber episode about a celebrity memoir that was far from the norm. Matthew Perry's autobiography, Friends, Lovers & The Big Terrible Thing, detailed his life, from being on set of one of the biggest shows in television history, to his struggles with addiction. With the sad news of Matthew Perry's death today, we wanted to share this conversation. The End Bits: Subscribe to Mamamia

item.title: Your Boss Wants To Know Less About Your Breakup | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia After experiencing heartbreak, is it better to tell the boss or cry privately in the bathroom? We discuss ‘heartbreak leave’ and why Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s day off has sparked debate. Plus, leave the babies alone! Paris Hilton is not happy about the trolls commenting on her baby son, which has us asking, what else should we avoid saying about babies? And, we wrap up our best and worst of the week which include a petition about formal dates, Gwyneth Paltrow and donuts…again.

item.title: ‘Our Generation Did It. So Maybe You Could Just Shut Up?’ | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia For almost 25 years Britney Spears’ image was treated and controlled like a product. Now she’s free to do what she wants, she’s choosing dancing in her underwear. So why are we so uncomfortable? We unpack and discuss her new memoir The Woman in Me. Plus, a new policy could see new parents in Australia get more money and time off after having a baby. Is it up to everyone to care, or just those who it directly affects?

item.title: Sis, Is This Your Man? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia There's a 'discipline crisis' in Australian schools. We dive into what that means for students and teachers. Plus, how long does it take to move on from divorce? Radio star Jackie O has opened up about her private life in an exclusive interview with Mia. And, Sis is that your man? We unpack the Facebook groups playing detective with our love lives. The End Bits: Listen to our latest subscriber episode: Mia's Best Chemist Beauty Buys Listen to Mia's No Filter episode: Jackie O On What She Wishes She'd Known About Divorce Read: The Sydney Facebook group exposing narcissists, predators and cheats.

item.title: One Of Us Missed The Marriage Window | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Madonna, radical icon of ageing or an artist who hasn’t ‘grown up’? The 65 year old is currently on her Celebration Tour and videos from the show are dividing the internet and us. Plus, is your relationship a ‘start-up’, or a ‘merger’ and what does that even mean? We breakdown the new analogy that’s defining relationships and claiming there is a ‘right’ age to wed.

item.title: The Moral Minefield Of Britney Spears’ Memoir | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: 'My Friends Have A Not-Kourtney Group Chat. I'm The Kourtney.' Subscribe to Mamamia The very first excerpt from Britney Spears’ memoir has been released overnight, revealing she had an abortion while dating Justin Timberlake, because he wasn’t ready to be a Dad. We ask who owns your abortion story? Plus, are mainstream discussions of menopause, baby brain and pelvic pain harming women’s chances at work?

item.title: Yes, No, And What Just Happened | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: Holly's Weirded Out By The Beckhams Subscribe to Mamamia Australia has voted ‘No’ to having an Indigenous Voice to Parliament, but where do we go from here? We unpack what led to the No campaign’s success and where the Yes campaign went wrong. Plus, does thinking about your parents having sex make you squeamish? One woman is making it known to her kids that mummy and daddy need their “special alone time”.

item.title: BONUS: Nothing To Wear | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description The 5 best sneaker trends to shop right now Introducing Mamamia's brand-new fashion podcast, Nothing To Wear. Prefer comfort over fashion? Well lucky for you sneakers are a hot trend that is here to stay. In this episode of Nothing To Wear, host Leigh Campbell and the queen of sneakers herself, Mia Freedman, unpack the key trends this season and how to style them in your current wardrobe. Whether it's to the office, to dinner or every day, learn how to wear sneakers confidently.

item.title: The Pressure To Post About Everything This Week | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: Holly's Weirded Out By The Beckhams Subscribe to Mamamia From the atrocities of terrorism and now war in Israel, to the Voice To Parliament Referendum, there is growing pressure for people to post their opinions on social media. We discuss the complexities and challenges with that. Plus, a very famous woman who built her brand on honesty and transparency has just admitted she’s been lying to us all for the past seven years .

item.title: If You Light A Candle Before Sex, I'll Scream | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Listen to our subscriber episode: An Argy Bargy About Rich People The noise-cancelling industry is booming. We discuss the surprising way people deal with loneliness ... but the irony is, it’s very anti-social. Plus, from lighting candles to gentle back rubs, Mia, Elfy and Clare unpack why your partners attempts to initiate intimacy might be making you flinch. And… have you ever felt sad during life moments that should be joyful?

item.title: The Beckham's Unpack Their Sticky Stuff | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Heartbreaking scenes continue to unfold in Israel after Hamas launched an attack over the weekend, killing hundreds of civilians. With graphic images being circulated online, we ask the question: how do you navigate social media during a time of terrorism and war. Plus, in pop culture news, it’s official David Beckham is a “wife guy.” Holly, Mia, and Clare unpack the new Beckham documentary. And, is your boss making you dance in the office a workplace health and safety hazard?

item.title: This Group Chat Is Ruining My Life | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: An Emergency Meeting About Taylor Swift's 'Fake' Boyfriend Subscribe to Mamamia Why are Jason Momoa, a.k.a. Aqua Man, and Taika Waititi being linked to the Australian Voice Referendum campaign? We discuss why the latest viral ad is making waves around Australia and internationally. Plus, from a chat with your family, another with your friends, to your kids school group, to simply organising a gift for someone.

item.title: The Great Wrinkle Reckoning Of 2023 | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: What We Each Most Dislike About Our Appearance Subscribe to Mamamia There’s a very silly feud between two Kardashian sisters that has taken far too much of our attention. Clare Stephens unpacks so we can all move on with our lives. Plus, Australia is more divided than ever, so why can't anyone agree anymore? And, ageing is apparently a "choice" for women. Holly, Mia and Clare have thoughts.

item.title: Bonus: How To Build A Human | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Introducing Mamamia's early childhood parenting podcast, How To Build A Human. There's a big wide world out there, and everyday is an opportunity for our kids to learn and grow... but what happens when external influences come into the mix. From pre-school friends, to TV ads and family members, our kids manage a lot of external influences every single day. In this episode of How To Build A Human, parenting expert Gen Muir shares with us some ways to keep your little one safe from negative influences and encourage them towards more positive ones.

item.title: Your Rich Friends Should Pay For Dinner | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: Why Mia And Holly Won’t Shut Up About The Super Models Subscribe to Mamamia Yes, you read that right. We'll be discussing if your rich friend should have to pay for dinner. Plus, is it possible for a man to give a compliment to a woman without being creepy? We have thoughts. And, Holly, Mia and Clare wrap up their best and worst of the week, which include a stolen identity, a sign of stress and a pedestrian echidna.

item.title: Come On Barbie Let's Go Get Divorced | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: A Fight About How To Get Ahead In The Workplace Subscribe to Mamamia Dan Andrews has resigned as Premier of Victoria effective immediately, but why is this news everywhere? What makes some politicians ‘cult figures’? Plus, the Barbie movie has inspired women to break up with their boyfriends or divorce their husbands, and we think they might have a point. And, the Unhappy Medium.

item.title: The Four Women We Can’t Agree On | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: Emergency Meeting About The Direction Of The Show Subscribe to Mamamia ‘The Super Models’ documentary starring Linda, Naomi, Christy and Cindy is now available to watch, but it has us asking the question: Are beautiful women just bad for the rest of us? Plus, Holly’s return to TikTok left her wondering why one side of the Voice To Parliament debate is getting so many views.

item.title: If Kanye West Offers To Dress You, Run. | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: Emergency Meeting About The Direction Of The Show Subscribe to Mamamia Rupert Murdoch has announced he's stepping down from his media empire at the age of 92. We unpack if we have a say as to whether or not, the older people in our life should "slow down". Plus, does Kanye West weaponise fashion against the women in his life? We have thoughts. And, Holly, Mia and Clare wrap up the week with their best and worst, which included a troll trap, a fashion win and one giant milestone for Mia.

item.title: What We Want From The Wives Of Bad Men | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: The Times We Lie Subscribe to Mamamia Do the wives of problematic men owe us anything? We unpack the scrutiny Bijou Phillips has faced, after announcing she is filing for divorce from Danny Masterson. Plus, we explain what an "Office 10" is, and why everyone is talking about it. And, Holly, Mia and Clare have thoughts on how to survive the friendship "stretch", when your friends become parents.

item.title: Hugh Jackman’s Divorce Is Really All About Us | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our subscriber episode: Mia’s Unexpected ADHD Symptom Subscribe to Mamamia The world continues to send sobbing emojis after learning about the surprising celebrity split of Hugh Jackman and Deborra-lee Furness. Holly, Mia and Clare discuss why we all feel so strongly about this relationship. Plus, we unpack Russell Brand's response, after he found himself at the centre of sexual assault allegations. And, we have thoughts on why one Australian multi-millionaire thinks the unemployment rate should rise to put workers back in their place.

item.title: Your Hard Questions About The Voice, Answered. | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia In this special bonus episode, we invited Quandamooka woman and ABC National Indigenous Affairs reporter Carly Williams on the show to answer Outlouders' questions about the upcoming Voice To Parliament Referendum. The End Bits Listen to Carly's podcast: The Voice Referendum Explained Listen to our subscriber episode: A Crisis Expert On Where Ashton And Mila Went Wrong Want more from Mia? Mia Freedman's Babble Newsletter Sign up to the Mamamia Out Loud Newsletter for all our recommendations in one place.

item.title: My Boobs Are Having A Moment | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest subscriber episode: A Crisis Expert On Where Ashton And Mila Went Wrong Subscribe to Mamamia Big boobs are back and they are everywhere. But why is the world obsessed with women's bodies being "trendy"? We have thoughts. Plus, have you experienced a 'Pandemic Skip'? We unpack the years we all "missed". And, Holly, Mia and Clare wrap up their best and worst of the week, which include a live TV groping, a traumatising chair, and the speech that’s gone viral.

item.title: Nicole Kidman & The Silliest Fight On Instagram | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest subscriber episode: The Traits We Hate Most About Ourselves Subscribe to Mamamia Amy Schumer's recent Instagram post of Nicole Kidman sitting awkwardly at the US Open is causing a stir, with many crying "cyberbullying”. We unpack the drama. And, what is ‘formal language’ in 2023? Is the old “Yours Sincerely" email sign-off being replaced by "Slay all day"? Plus, Mel B and Heidi Klum have been busy posing for photos with their daughters in their underwear, does anyone else think this is strange?

item.title: Ashton Kutcher & When The Monster Is Your Friend | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest subscriber episode: Mia’s Unexpected ADHD Symptom Subscribe to Mamamia 'That 70's Show' actor Danny Masterson has been sentenced to 30 years to life in prison for the rape of two women. A crime that has been rigorously scrutinised in the media. But why in the same breath, are we also talking about a character reference written by Ashton Kutcher & Mila Kunis? Plus, a loneliness cry for help.

item.title: More Free Bleeding, Less Soft Trolling | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest subscriber episode: Mia’s Unexpected ADHD Symptom Subscribe to Mamamia What is free bleeding? We unpack the latest trend of period pride and why so many women are feeling called to do it. Plus, are you a soft troll? Odds are you might be. We tell you why. And, Holly, Mia and Clare wrap up their best and worst of the week, which includes sitting-down shoes, burnout and a case of the missing rug.

item.title: The Smear Campaign Against Sophie Turner Has Begun | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest subscriber episode: Jessie Stephens On The First 8 Weeks Subscribe to Mamamia Everyone is talking about Joe Jonas and Sophie Turner's divorce. We discuss why, all of a sudden the wife is receiving a villain edit. Plus, Holly, Mia and Clare unpack why more than 4000 women in one Australian state have submitted their negative birth stories. And, why group-chats are not the place to make plans.

item.title: Roxy Jacenko And A Weight Loss Drug Warning | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest subscriber episode: The Meanest Things Anyone Has Ever Said About You Subscribe to Mamamia Roxy Jacenko has shared a cautionary tale after she went against her doctors advice regarding a weight-loss drug. We unpack why Roxy's experience is no joking matter. Plus, what is a frenemy and why are they the worst relationships for you? Holly, Mia and Clare have thoughts. And, does menopause have to be sexy?

item.title: Jessie Stephens: Something Bad Is Going To Happen | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to part two of this interview Jessie Stephens: Something Bad Is Going To Happen: Part Two Subscribe to Mamamia If you're struggling with anxiety & depression, reach out to Beyond Blue here. Before Jessie Stephen's went on maternity leave, she sat down with Mia on No Filter for their most candid conversation yet. Anxiety and depression are mental health issues that so many Australians will experience in their life.

item.title: Hamish Blake & The New Wave Of Dadding | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest subscriber episode: The Meanest Things Anyone Has Ever Said About You Subscribe to Mamamia Jessie Stephens’ first novel Something Bad is Going to Happen hit bookshops around the country this week and we could not be more proud. She tells us the story behind her brainchild. Plus, Hamish Blake has just been announced as Australia’s Father of the Year, but what does award-winning fatherhood actually look like?

item.title: The Influencer Who Really Hates Her European Holiday | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest subscriber episode where we tackle new listener dilemmas Subscribe to Mamamia The private diary entries of Amy Winehouse will soon be released by her parents. We take a deep dive into the ethics. Plus, are we ever truly “enough”, and is the world done with pressures on romantic love? We have thoughts. And, Holly, Clare and Elfy unpack the Australian influencer who is hating on her European holiday.

item.title: "Fake Feminists Are Trying To Kill Me" | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our recap of the And Just Like That finale episode: Samatha Came For 74 Seconds Subscribe to Mamamia It's the unsolicited sporting field kiss that has raised eyebrows around the world. We unpack the Spanish football saga surrounding football chief Luis Rubiales. Plus, can "life hacks" really improve your life? We have thoughts. And, why do weddings seem to expose family rifts? Holly, Mia and Clare take a deep dive into how even the Cyrus family can't escape wedding drama.

item.title: Jennifer Aniston, We Have Questions… | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our recap of the And Just Like That finale episode: Samatha Came For 74 Seconds Subscribe to Mamamia If you thought you knew everything about Jennifer Aniston, think again. Today we dish the details of her latest profile and unpack why Adam Sandler sends her flowers every year. Plus, what is negging, and is it good or bad? We discuss why some women like it. And, Holly, Mia and Clare wrap up the week with their best and worst, which include a slogan, Clare’s brain and a patch.

item.title: How Carrie Bradshaw Became A Monster | Mamamia Out Loud

Plus, can we engage in respectful debate on TV in 2023? We dive into why the fate of political show Q+A suggests otherwise.

item.title: Hot Girl Glimmers | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest And Just Like That recap here... Subscribe to Mamamia The Women’s World Cup finished with a glorious performance by Spain, so why didn’t the players celebrate victory with their coach? We unpack the details. Plus, from ‘girl dinners’, to ‘hot girl walks’ and ‘girl math’, we unpack why the world has suddenly become “girlified” and why it is problematic. And, Holly and Mia take a deep dive into the new phenomena of glimmers.

item.title: Re-Introducing Cancelled: Emily "We Get It, You’re Hot" Ratajkowski | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Hi Outlouders. Jumping your feed to give you a laugh and re-introduce you to Cancelled the show hosted by our very own Clare and Jessie Stephens. This episode is all about Emily Ratajkowski, aka Em Rata and judging her crimes which include: saying hair is feminine, her controversial book and her feud with Celeste Barber. And we assign charges and sentences accordingly. If you love this episode, there is plenty more where that came from and you can listen to them here!

item.title: Everybody’s Fighting About A Fake Nose | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest And Just Like That recap here... Is this offensive or is it just 'acting'? We discuss. Plus, are trigger warnings a load of BS? Holly thinks they're helpful, but Mia and Clare just don't agree. And…our hosts share their best and worst of the week including a certain woman’s right foot, a statistic we just can’t accept and a very complicated graph.

item.title: Don’t Interfere. This Is My Canon Event. | Mamamia Out Loud

Plus, what is a Canon Event and does everyone really have one that defines them?

item.title: Can We Talk About The Matildas’ Personal Lives? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our latest And Just Like That recap here... item.title: A Content Warning About A Content Warning | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Joe Biden is running for re-election in the 2024 US Presidential election. Does the reaction to this news tell us something about ageism, or realism? Plus, the Scottish comedian who tried to resist trigger warnings and what happened next. And, the green flags that mean you’re a good person. How many can you claim? The End Bits Watch Jessie and Clare record Cancelled live at Powerhouse Late

item.title: We Are Full Of Female Rage | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Barry Humphries, a cancellation, and how to react when an icon passes away. Plus, is it narcissistic to post a photo of yourself? A conversation about why we feel...kinda weird about posting selfies now. And what we’re too afraid to say about female rage, inspired by the latest Netflix show everyone is talking about. The End Bits RECOMMENDATIONS: Mia wants you to read I Really Didn’t Want to Go by Lauren Oyler

item.title: Are We Allowed To Say We Hate Our Bodies? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia A moment in everyone’s favourite kids' show enraged some parents this week. But is it a reflection of reality? Plus… Two famous women in the headlines are still being defined by moments of their lives from decades ago. Why can't we extract them from those narratives? And our best and worst of the week ranging from dogs to AI to holidays. The End Bits Listen to our last episode: Is Jealousy A Good Thing?

item.title: The Sex Lives Of Australian High School Kids | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to the full recap of Jessie's honeymoon here Subscribe to Mamamia Should you have to see a psychiatrist before you can get Botox? Soon, you might not have a choice. We unpack the cosmetic procedure mental health screening debate. Plus… A conversation about the 'don’t ask don’t tell' private school & the church that says sexually active students can’t hold leadership positions. And the 'Bookstagram' war that spiraled out of an innocent review.

item.title: A Very Candid Conversation About 'Fertility Privilege' | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Who’s in, who’s out, and who cares? Where we’re at with the coronation of King Charles and a few… empty seats. Plus… An honest conversation about fertility privilege. And Mia is back, and she has a BIG theory about Taylor Swift’s break-up that we need to argue about immediately. The End Bits RECOMMENDATIONS: Holly wants you to watch Pretty Baby: Brooke Shields on Disney+. Sign up to the Mamamia Out Loud Newsletter for all our reccos from the week in one place.

item.title: How 29 Minutes Of TV Perfectly Portrayed Modern Grief | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia A conversation about something of enormous importance that happened on Succession… and what it tells us about loss. Plus, a very famous woman is the latest to insist we should stop talking about women's bodies. And our best and worst of the week, ranging from chart-topping podcasts to rodents to elevators. The End Bits Our latest episode: Three Times We Were Meant To Be Happy, But Weren’t Read Nicolle Stuart's take on grief: 'I didn't experience grief until I was 34.

item.title: The Boomer-Millennial Fight That Makes Great TV | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia What is an A-list celebrity in 2023? Two famous Australians from two very different generations just clashed over that very question. Plus, self-care, boundary-setting, and toxicity. Is 'therapy-speak' making us selfish? And, should influencers have to declare if they’re using filters on their bodies and faces? There’s a proposed law on the table that says yes. The End Bits Listen to our latest episode: Messy Vs Optimised: Are You A Gwyneth Or A Winona?

item.title: EXTRA: Jessie's Been Doing 'Schema Therapy' | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Schema Therapy is the new trend sweeping psychologist offices in 2023. With an approach that brings together elements from both popular and experimental therapies, it's an approach that has a lot to do with understanding the core patterns we repeat throughout life. Our very own Jessie has started Schema Therapy and now swears by it, so we decided to pick her brain, just for this special episode.

item.title: Introducing But Are You Happy: Clare Stephens On Being Jealous Of Her Best Friend | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description This week at Mamamia we launched a new podcast called But Are You Happy? And we thought you might like to hear it... Over eight weeks, Clare Stephens is sitting down with 8 celebrities to ask them to get vulnerable with her. But before she does, it's only fair that Clare opens up first. Clare sits down with the host of No Filter Claire Murphy to discuss her vulnerabilities - competing with the person you love the most, dealing with mental health, jealousy, ambition, and… whether or not she is happy.

item.title: EXTRA: The Fight That Wasn't Meant To Be A Podcast | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Who sleeps with the baby? Is it a relay, tag-team affair? Or a three-legged race through all seasons and terrain? On today's special episode, Holly and Mia get stuck into a fiery disagreement that no one saw coming. The End Bits: Sign up to the Mamamia Out Loud Newsletter for all our recos from the week in one place. GET IN TOUCH: Feedback? We’re listening. Call the pod phone on 02 8999 9386 or email us at outloud@mamamia.

item.title: The Surprise Allure Of This Pathetic Man | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Want a full breakdown of Jessie's wedding? Listen here... Two high-profile cases in the media this week and what they tell us about reaching a conviction in a sexual assault trial. Plus, the stealth marketing genius that has kids paying tens, hundreds, and thousands of dollars for… a bottle of soft drink. And the internet has a new Girlboss; Kendall Roy. What’s behind the allure of the pathetic man, and what does Succession tell us about the surprising status symbols of the uber-rich?

item.title: When Your Co-Host Earns Twice As Much As You | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Click here to see Jessie & Luca's wedding album Subscribe to Mamamia What happens when you find out your job-share “best mate” earns almost twice what you do? And, we talk about highlights after Gwyneth Paltrow's meme-worthy trial.

And what constitutes cheating? And, our best and worst moments of the week, which range from difficult dogs to Hen’s parties to retractions.

item.title: The 'Disgusting' Wedding Vows We Can't Agree On | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen here to unpack the 'vanishingly small drama' that is the Selena/Hailey feud Subscribe to Mamamia Three children and three adults are dead after another school shooting in America. Plus, does Reese Witherspoon’s divorce announcement tell us something about how non-famous people should share their break-up news? And, the viral wedding vows that everyone on the Internet has labelled ‘disgusting.

item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia A very famous make-up boss says her husband has never seen her without makeup. We have questions. Plus, there’s a narrative playing out in the news at the moment about Australian music legend Molly Meldrum. Should he just 'stay home'?

And, has Instagram and TikTok’s 'Get Ready With Me' craze gone too far when we’re doing ‘GRWM: Nan’s Funeral’ content? Or is it just glorious vulnerability?

And, our best and worst of the week ranging from Covid, vaginas, and gratitude for the faintest of wrinkles. Subscribe to Mamamia The End Bits: Listen to our latest episode: What Mia, Holly & Jessie's Partners All Have In Common

And, the ‘click or clash’ personality test that will help you find your people The End Bits: Listen to Fill My Cup to hear Allira's conversation with Dr Ali Walker, about why we click with some people immediately and why we might clash with others.

item.title: Introducing: HER with Sophie Cachia | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Introducing Mamamia's newest podcast HER with Sophie Cachia Sophie Cachia was a married mum-of-two when her life changed unexpectedly after meeting… HER. And she isn’t alone. Over six episodes, Sophie speaks to women from across the world whose lives changed when they discovered they were attracted to women. This episode Sophie speaks to Zara Cooper founder of Paperkrane shoes. Zara was married to her high school sweetheart for nearly 20 years, when one day at a children's birthday party she met a woman who changed the trajectory of her life.

item.title: The Friendship Breakup Text You Should Never Send | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Some very passive-aggressive media coverage this week has us unpacking society’s big problem with women who aren’t with their children all the time. Plus, corporate speak has had a comeback and it's creeping into your friendships. Is it a lesson in how not to end a friendship? And, our best and worst moments of the week, ranging from trivia to DIY-related injuries to a dog therapy update.

item.description: Podcast Description Listen to Holly's One Piece of Baby Advice for Jessie The weight-loss “miracle drug” that Hollywood stars have co-opted from the people who actually need it. The End Bits: Support those affected by the earthquake in Turkey and Syria: AKUT Search and Rescue Association Direct Relief: Turkey-Syria Earthquake Relief Listen to The Quicky: Is Ozemipic Really A Weight Loss Wonder Drug?

item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia On today's show, we're unpacking the contradictions and coded bigotry surrounding the outrage over Sam Smith's new music video. Plus, a corner of the internet is calling for the cancellation of gym mirrors. Do we care more about how we look when we exercise, than the actual exercise itself? And our best and worst of the week ranging from teenagers to deadlines to scary swims.

item.title: Marie Kondo Has Gone Goblin Mode | Mamamia Out Loud

And… has the viral parenting advice out of Denmark unlocked the key to living with teens?

item.title: Australian Of The Year: Not Everyone's Happy | Mamamia Out Loud

The End Bits: Read how we covered Pip Edwards last week: How Pip Edwards built a global multi-million dollar brand in 7 years.

item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Jelena Dokic has been the target of online abuse amidst a controversial Australian Open. What does the horrific trolling of a former tennis champ/accomplished commentator tell us about the idea of a woman's 'acceptability window'? Plus, how has dating evolved in 2023? The lessons from a 'Please Date Me' PowerPoint that’s going viral. And…our best and worst of the week, including a live TV stuff up, a smoothie and a new couch.

item.title: Grandma Has Had Enough Of Your Sh*t | Mamamia Out Loud

Is she the asshole? We discuss. The End Bits: Listen to yesterday's episode: Britney Spears & The Most Likely Explanation

item.title: How The Office Cake Became Problematic | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia The Harbour Bridge was shut down over the weekend for Ryan Gosling & A Hollywood Blockbuster. Just last month, a woman was sentenced to 15 months in prison for stopping traffic in the very same place. Is this a double standard or is there more to the story? Plus, an explainer about ChatGPT, the technology that’s about to change everything. And is office cake culture as bad for you as passive smoking?

item.title: The Clarke-Karlos Circus: An Unpopular Opinion | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia The Prime Minister of New Zealand/feminist icon, Jacinda Ardern, has resigned. So what, if anything, can we learn from the frank admission that her 'tank' is empty? Plus, some of the most famous people in Australia had a shirtless brawl in a park and we’ve all been watching with popcorn. On today's show, we unpack the weirdest news story of the year so far. And, our best and worst of the week which include scams, fashion trends we wish would go away, and a room of one’s own.

item.title: What You've Never Noticed About Your Friends | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia It's awards season in Hollywood and our very own Cate Blanchett is cleaning up, but she's calling BS on the whole thing. What is the patriarchal pyramid, and what does it have to do with awards shows? Plus, a Melbourne worker has gone viral after having his pay docked for being on his phone during a shift. What are the rules when it comes to devices in the workplace?

item.title: The Surprising Prince Harry Take | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our deep dive into Prince Harry's new book Subscribe to Mamamia Does Prince Harry have a problem with women? Dissecting a fresh take from his book that we didn't see coming. Plus, what’s the cost of dressing up as a Nazi? What the NSW Premier has in common with a Prince. And unpacking the break-up anthem of the Summer from Miley Cyrus. What does it tell us about how women handle heartbreak, and how the media treat them?

item.title: SUMMER SERIES: 'As A Mother' Respectfully, We Disagree | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia to catch up on all our subscriber-exclusive episodes Every year, we discuss around 700 topics on Mamamia Out Loud. Seven. Hundred. We don't always agree, but we've gotten pretty good at respectful disagreement. Mamamia Subscribers have heard us diving deep into our 'greatest hits' arguments this summer, so to give you a taste of what you've been missing, we're sharing one of the all-time classics; the infamous 'As A Mother' barney.

item.title: Word Of The Year 2023 & A Special Announcement | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia to catch up on all our subscriber-exclusive episodes It’s the first day of 2023, happy new year, Outlouders. You know what time it is...it's Word Of The Year! New Year's resolutions are notorious for falling over, so instead, every year we choose a word to set an intention for the year ahead of us. There's no pass or fail, word of the year is about creating a focus or filter for the months, decisions and moments to come.

item.title: SUMMER SERIES: Our Favourite Recos Of 2022 | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia to catch up on all our subscriber-exclusive episodes Every episode of Mamamia Out Loud wraps up with a recommendation to help you find the gems within the endless pit of content we're all trying to navigate. At the end of every year, we zoom in on those recommendations to pick out the ones we couldn't (and didn't) stop thinking about. In a special summer bonus, Mia, Holly & Jessie take you through the very best of the best Outlouder-approved TV shows, books, and films that got them through the year.

item.title: SUMMER SERIES: Our Best & Worst Moments Of The Year | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia to catch up on all our subscriber-exclusive episodes From war breaking out to monarchs dying, grown men slapping each other, celebrity court battles, and on-set dramas, to a new Prime Minister and the censuring of an old one... 2022 was never short on headlines, and a lot has been said about it, but in today's summer bonus episode, it's time to step back from the news cycle and reflect inwards, as Mia, Holly, and Jessie open up about the good, the bad and the ugly of their 2022.

item.title: The Fight We Forgot About This Year | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia to catch up on all our subscriber-exclusive episodes It's our last regular show of 2022, so we're casting our minds back to ponder the all-too-important but rather hazy question, 'what the hell happened this year?' Plus, the problem with the questions we’re being told not to ask our friends and family this Christmas. And, our best and worst of the week which include the infuriating term thrown at Mia, some tragically stubborn statistics, and the most wonderful birthday presents.

item.title: The Celebrity Nepo Baby Conspiracy | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Nepo-babies. Chances are, you’re seeing them all over your social media and television screens. So what are they, and what’s the world’s problem with them? Plus, why do some gifts make you cry with happiness, and some make you feel nothing? The psychology of gift-giving. And does being a real friend mean offering brutal honesty or unconditional support? The End Bits: RECOMMENDATIONS: Holly wants you to make Outlouder's salads from our Facebook group.

item.title: The Vile Opinion That Should Never Have Been Published | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia We thought we might have a royal-free episode, until an unspeakable troll came back from lunch with Camilla, opened his laptop, and began to write… Plus, should women go on strike at Christmas? 'Tis the season for burnout over the mental load. And, a dilemma that’s close to home about asking favours from strangers. The End Bits: RECOMMENDATIONS: Jessie wants you to watch Wakefield on ABC iView Sign up to the Mamamia Out Loud Newsletter for all our reccos from the week in one place.

item.title: Harry & Meghan Just Blew The Whole Thing Up | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our bonus episode unpacking Volume II of Harry & Meghan here 'Institutionalised gaslighting,' brothers at war, and more drama than a White Lotus finale. What happened on the last three episodes of Harry & Meghan? Plus, Twitter is in chaos and Meta's profits are in free fall. Is social media dead? Mia has a very convincing argument that we’re at the end of our obsession. And, our best and worst of the week ranging from broken dogs to water cooler TV to Jessie’s dream interview.

item.title: Our New Guru Is A Cheating Wife | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our episode unpacking the entire The White Lotus finale here. An ordinary Monday afternoon in Australia. Six people dead by gunfire in what seems to have been an ambush by extreme conspiracy theorists. It's not a story we are used to seeing here, so is it a senseless tragedy or a sign of something bigger? Plus, a she-said-she-said influencer war and what it tells us about slut-shaming, feminism, and the patriarchy.

item.title: The Unspoken Hell Of Forced Friendship | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia The media have had a big old dig at Harry and Meghan for invading their own privacy, and they’ve had a dig right back. So what’s the line between privacy and control? Plus, there’s a gender sleep gap, and you’ll never guess, but it’s not in women’s favour. Why? And, it’s White Lotus day, but whether you’re watching or not, what does the show tell us about the hell of forced friendship?

item.title: Harry & Meghan: The Verdict | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our bonus episode about Harry & Meghan’s doco here You'll never guess what we're talking about on today's show...Christmas has come early. We need to talk about Meghan & Harry Plus, have we fetishized friendship over family? And our best and worst of the week, ranging from new frocks to sickness to harsh bikini realities. The End Bits: Subscribe to listen to our special bonus episode about Harry & Meghan’s doco here

item.title: When Celebrity Weight Loss Became Uncool | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia ​​Yesterday, news broke that age 71, Kirstie Alley had died. Actress. Comedian. Writer. Mother. Wife. Scientologist. Like many of us, she was many things, but what does her legacy tell us about the complicated issue of monetising weight loss Plus, the mainstreaming of sexual strangulation, And… to breed or not to breed? The conversation between three men that’s obsessing Jessie Stephens. The End Bits: RECOMMENDATIONS: Holly wants you to watch Colin From Accounts on Binge

item.title: Team Sussex Vs. Team Wales: Choose Your Fighter | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Are you Team Sussex or Team Wales? Wherever you land on the Harry & Megs versus Wills & Kate argument will tell us exactly how old you are. Plus, what a viral fashion trend tells us about Barbie's transformation into a feminist icon of inclusion. And, what will it take to turn the volume down on Kanye West? The End Bits: RECOMMENDATIONS: Mia & Emma want you to watch The L Word: Generation Q on Stan

item.title: The Influencers' ADHD Wars | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Everyone is talking about China and the wave of protests across the country, but what does it have to do with the FIFA World Cup in Qatar? Plus, two influencers are having a very public argument about ADHD. Why? And should we all stop being so…. authentic? One author is calling bullsh*t on authenticity. The End Bits: RECOMMENDATIONS: Mia wants you to watch The Real Bling Ring: Hollywood Heist.

item.title: An Argy Bargy About Period Leave | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Miscarriage, menstruation, and menopause. With all we have to deal with, should women be entitled to extra leave from their jobs? Plus, what do we need to understand about the fashion brand accused of sexualising young children in its latest ad campaign? And the tech bro ‘live forever’ movement we want no part of. The End Bits: RECOMMENDATIONS: Mia wants you to use a pill box organiser as your next jewellery storage travel hack.

item.title: The Most Important Decision You'll Ever Make | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Last night's ARIA awards were supposed to be about gender inclusivity, but with only a handful of non-male winners, what is the future of breaking down the binaries of award show categories? Plus, the viral data about who gets most of our time and why it’s made Mia cranky. And, our best and worst of the week… ranging from midnight dashes to Mia’s house, friend reunions, and Abba medleys

item.title: Bec Judd Has Changed Her Business Model | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Peter Helliar has announced he's leaving The Project, as changes to the panel continue to dominate headlines. With more choice than ever before about what we watch and when, why are we so attached to the faces in our living room? Plus, Rebecca Judd has changed her business model and people have a lot of thoughts. And, we need to talk about Jessie’s rules for mothers-in-law. The End Bits:

item.title: Lisa Wilkinson’s Exit & ‘Targeted Toxicity’ | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Lisa Wilkinson has announced she's leaving The Project. What does it tell us about 'targeted toxicity' and the extra job women in the public eye unwittingly sign up for? Plus, David Beckham, Robbie Williams, and why a comedian is shredding $10,000 over the very controversial football world cup. And, is leisure time inherently sexist? The double standard when it comes to 'me time' that's got Jessie riled up.

item.title: Demisexuals & The New Coming Out | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Elon Musk has come up with a new workplace mantra, and it’s the opposite of ‘quiet quitting’. So, what does being “hardcore” at work mean? Plus, what’s demisexuality, and what does it tell us about young people’s approach to sex? And, our best and worst of the week, ranging from concert tickets to flood rescue to dream interviews to friendship maintenance. Donate to flood relief via Givit, or The Red Cross The End Bits:

item.title: Trump Is Running Again And Nobody Panic | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia It's official. Donald Trump is back. The former U.S President has announced his intention to run for the Republican party candidacy for the 2024 election. Some of us are freaking out, but Mia thinks she can reassure us. Plus, a millennial icon has declared ‘aging is fully in’, and painted her hair grey to do it. So is it empowering, or insulting? And, the latest innovations in artificial intelligence have us wondering if you could ‘fake’ a digital interaction with a lost loved one, would you?

item.title: The Casting Decision That’s Killed The Crown | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Vote for Mamamia Out Loud as Listeners' Choice in the Australian Podcast Awards What happens to the people we canceled during the pandemic? An article reminding us about a prominent anti-vaxxer has left us wondering. Plus, the latest on-screen portrayal of Prince Charles has sparked a chaotic theory about the relationship between the royals and Netflix juggernaut, The Crown. And… what refusing to adopt new technologies in the workplace really says about you.

item.title: Respectfully, We Disagree About Jennifer Aniston | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Vote for Mamamia Out Loud as Listeners' Choice in the Australian Podcast Awards Jennifer Aniston has opened up about her struggle to get pregnant. What does it tell us about biological clocks and how we treat childfree women? Plus, the argument we’ve been bursting to have about the accompanying photoshoot… And… our best and worst of the week which includes a viral video, sons, and Jessie's embarrassing on-stage moment.

item.title: Introducing Here If You Need: Where Women's Sport Comes First | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Outlouders! We've got a new podcast we want to tell you about. It's called Here If You Need, and it launched today. Join Olympic swimmer Cate Campbell & sports journalist Hayley Willis every week as they break down the week in sport, share an inspiring story from a legendary woman of the game, and give you a cheat sheet for sports chat to use every weekend. If you love what you hear and want to support women's sport, come and follow us wherever you get your podcasts: https://pod.

item.title: Fake 'Sad Girls' & The Elon Garbage Fire | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Vote for Mamamia Out Loud as Listeners' Choice in the Australian Podcast Awards Everyone’s worried about Elon Musk being in charge of Twitter. So, who’s been fired, who’s being let back in, and what does it all mean? Plus, Have we done away with social rules in favour of boundaries? And… what is ‘crying makeup’? What the latest TikTok trend tells us about the 'cute-ification' of mental illness.

item.title: The Complication In Aaron Carter’s Death | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Vote for Mamamia Out Loud as Listeners' Choice in the Australian Podcast Awards What does the death of a noughties pop star teach us about grief, addiction, and complicated families? And… an Outlouder dilemma about busyness, values, and when two sisters are in very different life stages.

item.description: Podcast Description Vote for Mamamia Out Loud as Listeners' Choice in the Australian Podcast Awards In a turn of events we didn't see coming we're cranky with Rihanna. And… our best and worst of the week which includes meds, our Wednesday guest host, and Holly's hard launch.

item.description: Podcast Description Claim a free ticket to our virtual tour show An elderly man was attacked with a hammer in his own home, and somehow this has become a ‘debate’ about free speech in the US. item.description: Podcast Description Listen to How To Build A Human here When it comes to parenting toddlers, there’s a lot of advice…everywhere. How To Build A Human is Mamamia’s new podcast for parents of toddlers. And on today's episode, we're talking about raising creative humans with former Yellow Wiggle Sam Moran and the founder of Connected Parenting, Genevive Muir.

item.title: Carrie Bickmore & The Hard Truth About Decisions | Mamamia Out Loud

item.description: Podcast Description Get tickets to see us live, or stream the tour, thanks to Priceline Pharmacy HERE. item.description: Podcast Description Get tickets to see us live, or stream the tour, thanks to Priceline Pharmacy HERE. But do rituals of grief, like funerals, bring families together, or exacerbate existing rifts? We’ve talked about quiet quitting on this podcast before in the context of work… but is it possible to quietly quit a relationship?

item.title: A Very “Reprehensible” Woman | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Get tickets to see us live, or stream the tour, thanks to Priceline Pharmacy HERE. Plus, there’s a story that really riled us up this week, and it’s about an NRLW player named Caitlin Moran. And our best and worst of the week, ranging from funerals to concerts to the best kind of billionaires.

item.title: Royal Marriages Are Really Weird | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Jessie can't stop clicking on articles about the body language between the Prince and Princess of Wales. How do royal marriages differ from others, and why do we expect romance from what was historically accepted as a political arrangement? Plus, is it wrong to ask guests at your baby shower to leave if they don’t bring a gift? A viral video has the internet divided on present etiquette.

item.title: The Royals Left To Clean Up The Mess | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Get tickets to our live tour thanks to Priceline Pharmacy HERE. Is the admiration we have for the late Queen’s sense of duty and sacrifice outdated… and does it also explain why so many people are feeling uncomfortable right now? Plus, has “introvert pride” made us much more likely to be socially isolated? And, is a sex toy an appropriate gift from your partner if… you didn’t ask for it?

item.title: The Queen’s Death. It’s Complicated. | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Get tickets to our live tour thanks to Priceline Pharmacy HERE. Queen Elizabeth II is dead. Only two days ago, we were talking about the Queen swearing in the new British Prime Minister Liz Truss, and how well she looked. Now, it seems the whole world is in shock. While our views on the Royal Family are complicated, we think the Queen was probably the best of them. Were we ready for her loss?

item.title: We're Officially Worried, Darling | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Get tickets to our live tour thanks to Priceline Pharmacy HERE. Not since The Oscars 'Slap' of January 2022 has a celebrity moment captured so much of our attention and imagination as Harry Styles spitting on Chris Pine. After watching the video approximately 700 times, we're unpacking exactly what went down at the Venice film festival premiere of Don't Worry Darling. Plus, is it time to rethink covid iso?

item.title: Are We Even Pretending To Get Along Anymore? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Don't miss out on tickets to our upcoming tour, sign up for the Out Loud newsletter: https://www.mamamia.com.au/newsletter/ US President Joe Biden gave a big speech on the weekend, the most passionate address of his presidency so far. It's got us wondering... have we given up on bridge-building? Plus, is the concept of ‘maternal instinct’ bad for women? And when it comes to Meghan Markle… is it ok to switch sides?

item.title: A Passionate Defence Of Leonardo DiCaprio | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Don't miss any details about our upcoming tour, sign up for the Out Loud newsletter: https://www.mamamia.com.au/newsletter/ Subscribe to Mamamia Jessie has an unpopular opinion about Leonardo DiCaprio. 'Let the man live,' she says. But Holly and Mia aren't letting her off the hook that easily. Plus, are you in sync with the season your life is in… And our best and worst of the week, ranging from parties, rest, women ruling the world and grief.

item.title: The Teacher’s Pet Verdict: A Debrief | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Don't miss any details about our upcoming tour, sign up for the Out Loud newsletter: https://www.mamamia.com.au/newsletter/ Subscribe to Mamamia Yesterday, after four decades, Chris Dawson was found guilty of murdering his wife, Lynette. We debrief on our thoughts in the wake of the verdict, from the long road ahead for other victims of this trial, to the vindication of podcaster Hedley Thomas and what comes next. Plus, a listener dilemma about a school reunion that’s… very close to home.

item.title: BONUS: Mia & Jessie Grill Holly About The Couple Upstairs | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description The day has finally arrived! Holly’s new book, The Couple Upstairs, is officially out in the world. Mia and Jessie got to read it first, so in this special bonus episode, hear them debrief with Holly about all their feelings and questions. Plus, Holly reads the entire first chapter of The Couple Upstairs, just for Outlouders. The Couple Upstairs by Holly Wainwright is available in all good bookstores and online now.

item.title: Everyone’s Wrong About Olivia Wilde | Mamamia Out Loud

Over the weekend, Shaquille O’Neil met with Anthony Albanese in a move that's being labeled a ‘clueless and out of touch publicity stunt'. Was it a good thing? Or an embarrassing misstep? Plus, as another anniversary rolls around - is there anything new to say about the death of Princess Diana?

item.title: Some Very Honest Thoughts About Meghan Markle’s Podcast | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia It took two years but Meghan Markle has finally released her highly anticipated podcast, Archetypes. What do we really think about it, and what does it tell us about ambition? Plus, what happens when someone with millions of followers on social media has a meltdown in real time? And our best and worst of the week, ranging from bums to invites to printers. RECOMMENDATIONS: Holly wants you to watch Victoria's Secret Angels and Demons on Prime Video

item.title: The Surprise Rebrand Of Nicole Kidman | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia There’s a cover shoot that might have been passed around your group chats over the last 24 hours. What does it tell us about the 'rebrand' of Nicole Kidman? Plus, how do you know if you’re 'toxic' and is it a label you can ever refute? And, is there power in giving up on your dreams? What the latest Masked Singer reveal has us wondering about success and happiness.

item.title: How Is Brad Pitt Getting Away With It? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Mia is ready to stage an intervention with Holly about Brad Pitt after an FBI report has revealed what actually happened on that plane with Angelina Jolie and his family in 2016. So why is he being protected? Plus, there’s a name for the complete hormonal overload that women go through when they become mothers and thank god. And, in case you missed it, bleached eyebrows are coming back in and Jessie is thrilled.

item.title: Injectables Have A Brand New Hype Guy | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia The latest celebrity ambassador for anti-wrinkle injections is a man and… we have a few questions about it. Plus, in case you missed it, Scotland made history this week when it became the first country to offer free pads, tampons, and other period products nationwide… And then they hired a man as their ‘period dignity officer’. And, our best and worst of the week; from calming music to Scomo.

item.title: 'Side-Hustle Scomo' Is The Biggest Story In The World | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia It’s been revealed this week that Scott Morrison held some ‘secret’ positions during his Prime Ministership - including Treasurer, without anyone knowing. So what the heck does that mean? Plus, why are parents deleting photos of their kids off social media? And in case you missed it, JLO and Ben Affleck are getting married (again) and it’s making us think that entree weddings are a thing.

item.title: The Peach Test That’s Dividing The Internet | Mamamia Out Loud

And on the show today, we’re talking about the peach test that’s dividing the internet, and no, it’s not about an actual peach. Plus, you might have seen the name Salman Rushdie making headlines over the weekend, due to pretty horrific circumstances. So, why was this author targeted?

item.title: Why Andrew Tate Is The Most Viral Person On The Internet | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Over the last few weeks, you might have heard the name, Andrew Tate. He’s framed as the King Of Toxic Masculinity, and he appeals to men, apparently, who want to learn about business, how to be a man, and dating. And as Jessie explains, he’s one of the most dangerous people on the internet right now… Plus, in an interview with US-based Marie Claire Magazine, Mindy Kaling said that she wishes every woman had the opportunity to freeze their eggs.

item.title: A Throwdown About Staying Home With Kids | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Last week, Beyonce changed the lyrics of a new song after she was accused of using an ableist slur. It's the same thing Lizzo did just a month or so prior. This week, Eminem released a greatest hits album, and one of the tracks includes that very same slur. Will he be held to the same standard? Plus, a listener dilemma about an over-stepping Mother In Law.

item.title: Porn & The Ultimate Relationship Dealbreaker | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia 'Quiet Quitting' is the more refined, less impulsive cousin of 'The Great Resignation.' It means doing the bare minimum at work and it's going global. Why? Plus, free abortions in the ACT… an honest discussion about our first reaction to the news. And the rise of the anti-porn feminist. Can you demand your partner give up porn? The End Bits: RECOMMENDATIONS: Mia wants you to watch Trainwreck: Woodstock 99 on Netflix

item.title: A Catholic, A Muslim & A Jewish Woman Walk Into A Studio | Mamamia Out Loud

And our best and worst of the week, from a hurtful pile on, to Instagram hackers, to Susan getting very, very excited about her new office…. The End Bits:

item.title: The Great Uncancellation Has Begun | Mamamia Out Loud

And, Will Smith has come back and he wants you to know he's sorry. Is he on the road to redemption?

item.title: The Topic We Shouldn't Have Discussed | Mamamia Out Loud

Why are women talking about it, and what's the real problem with this story? Plus, why one of the most famous women in the world is being accused of ableism, and what might be missing from the discussion. And, the age of the climate criminal is upon us.

item.title: Is Ghosting Really Emotional Abuse? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia Does ghosting classify as emotional abuse? According to a proposed bill, absolutely. Plus, a spicy listener dilemma about infidelity. The End Bits: Subscribe to Mamamia RECOMMENDATIONS: Jessie wants you to listen to Deborah Frances-White on Conversations Sign up to the Mamamia Newsletter here GET IN TOUCH:

item.title: The Big Jersey Debate | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Want more Mamamia Out Loud? Subscribe to Mamamia for unlimited access to Out Loud, five days a week. A jersey, a boycott, and an apology. It's the story that's revealed how complicated cultural change is within an organisation as diverse yet traditional as the NRL. Plus, Holly has 25 questions about the optics of the 'Bennifer' Honeymoon. And, what's happened to your Instagram? The End Bits: Subscribe to Mamamia

item.title: TikTok Is The New Feedback Form | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Want more Mamamia Out Loud? Subscribe to Mamamia for unlimited access to Out Loud, five days a week. In case you missed it, Splendour in the Grass happened over the weekend, and it was a muddy mess. It has us wondering - is TikTok the new version of a feedback form? Plus, have we found the last un-cancellable celebrity of Generation X? And, is long Covid a feminist issue?

item.title: BONUS: Got The Sunday Sads? This Will Help | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Mamamia has a new podcast! Ever wake up on a Sunday feeling a bit... sick about the week ahead? Ever wished you had a guide to help you shake it off and feel better? Fill My Cup is here for you. It's an overwhelm-fighting well-being show hosted by self-described witch Allira Potter that will give you practical tools to make your week that little bit better. If you liked this episode, subscribe to Fill My Cup here: https://omny.

item.title: A Conversation About ‘Birthing Parents’ | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to yesterday's subscriber-only segment here: mamamia.com.au/podcasts/mamamia-out-loud/empath-or-empathetic Wanting to surround yourself with your biggest fans is only human, but it means you could be missing out on a few things. Why should you befriend people you admire, instead? Plus, a Medicare form for new parents has caused a lot of hand-wringing. And our best and worst of the week, ranging from Jessie’s celebrity clashes to Brad Pitt to Foot and Mouth.

item.title: The Bikini Photo You're Not Allowed To Share | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Mia is back from her holiday and she has a question: can we please stop taking photos of our bodies after babies? Plus, who helps the cancelled celebrities? And, on Sunday afternoon, church-goers in Perth were treated to a very special sermon from our former Prime Minister, Scott Morrison. And we need to discuss… The End Bits: Subscribe to Mamamia RECOMMENDATIONS: Mia wants you to go on a holiday, take some time off work, and reconnect with your loved ones.

item.title: JLO & The Rise Of The Anti Wedding | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description It’s a bit of a celebrity news bonanza today and one such story concerns a very famous woman and the man who’s reportedly cheating on her and why everyone is so very surprised. And the other is the fact that Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got married over the weekend and Holly thinks anti-weddings are here to stay. Plus, what the heck is blowfishing? And do you do it?

item.title: Kindness Porn & What Grinds Our Gears | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to yesterday's subscriber-only segment here: https://www.mamamia.com.au/podcasts/mamamia-out-loud/nipples-ugly-trainers-fashion-crystal-ball On the show today, what is kindness porn and why is it pissing us off? Plus, Jessie Stephens, the queen of canceling, has a bone to pick with universities. And our best and worst of the week which includes Neighbours, dinner guests, and… being someone’s daughter-in-law. The End Bits: Subscribe to Mamamia RECOMMENDATIONS: Jessie wants you to watch The Crime Of The Century on Binge Sign up to the Mamamia Newsletter here Watch Susan's pilot of Dinner Guests here: https://10play.

item.title: Are We On ‘Farting Terms’ Yet? | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to yesterday's subscriber-only segment here: mamamia.com.au/podcasts/mamamia-out-loud/the-one-where-jessie-luca-got-engaged-pt-2/ As the knock-on effects of the reversal of Roe versus Wade continue, it's now men who are looking to take charge against unwanted pregnancies. There's been a huge spike in vasectomy bookings, and it's a trend we're seeing in Australia, too. What does it tell us? Plus, anti-goals are the new goals. But… what the hell are they? And the influencer who refused to fart in front of her boyfriend.

item.title: The Problem With Kim Kardashian’s Underdog Complex | Mamamia Out Loud
item.description: Podcast Description Subscribe to Mamamia We’re only halfway through the year but it feels like 2022 is a career-defining era for Kim Kardashian... But she wants you to know she’s not the person you think. Kim Kardashian is an underdog. Plus, apparently, a holiday isn’t enough to reset burnout. In a conversation that’s particularly relevant to one Jessie Stephens, how do you fend off burnout for real? And the unspoken rule of lending money to loved ones…
